p: In the biotoxicity assays, the essential oil extracted from V. gardneriana was highly toxic to A. guerreronis (LC 50 0.8577 mg/mL; CI 0.67-1.15; x 2 = 3.17, df = 2, P = 0.20). In contrast, it was not possible to estimate the LC 50 from V. capitata, V. megapotamica and V. rufescens essential oils, as increasing concentrations (0.1, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 1.8, 2.0, and 2.3 mg/mL) of these oils did not kill adults of A. guerreronis over a period of 24 h. As a way of toxicity comparison, the acaricide abamectin, sprayed at its label rate, inflicted 100% mortality to A. guerreronis.
